data.title: An Introduction To Literature In Willy Russell's...
data.meta_description: Free Essay: Introduction to literature: English literature, formed by three types of genre: drama, poetry, and prose. Drama is a public address or discourse...
data.text:
Introduction to literature:

English literature, formed by three types of genre: drama, poetry, and prose.

Drama is a public address or discourse and it is a script written to be read or performed, Poetry is when a sound and meaning of a language compiled to create ideas and feeling and prose is a communicative style that sounds natural and uses grammatical structure, writers use all of their creativity and techniques to create a piece.

This essay aims to interpret the social context, genre and the writing techniques of three different texts: Frankenstein written by Mary Shelly a fictional story about a monster in this world, I have a dream by Martin Luther King a non-fictional speech written about the writer’s life and Educating Rita by Willy Russell, a drama about the relationship between a freshman student in open university and her professor.

Willy Russell, an English dramatist, was born in 1947 in Liverpool.He became a “hairdresser on leaving school, then undertook a variety of jobs, also writing songs which were performed in local folk clubs. He also wrote songs and sketches for local radio programmers. At twenty years of age, he returned to college and became a teacher in Toxteth, after which he began to become interested in writing drama.” (Cited in www.literature.britishcouncil.org)

In 1981 Willy Russell published a new play called Educating Rita inspired by his life the story is about young women who aim to study for higher education through Open University. In
